metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: XSD Date and Time Data Types
Date and time data types are used for values that contain date and time.
content.html: Date and time data types are used for values that contain date and time.

content.text: Date Data Type
The date data type is used to specify a date.
content.html: The date data type is used to specify a date.

content.text: The date is specified in the following form "YYYY-MM-DD" where:
content.html: The date is specified in the following form "YYYY-MM-DD" where:

content.text: Note: All components are required!
content.html: Note: All components are required!

content.text: The following is an example of a date declaration in a schema:
content.html: The following is an example of a date declaration in a schema:

content.code_html: <xs:element name="start" type="xs:date"/>

content.text: An element in your document might look like this:
content.html: An element in your document might look like this:

content.code_html: <start>2002-09-24</start>

content.text: Time Zones
To specify a time zone, you can either enter a date in UTC time by adding a "Z" behind the date - like this:
content.html: To specify a time zone, you can either enter a date in UTC time by adding a "Z" behind the date - like this:

content.code_html: <start>2002-09-24Z</start>

content.text: or you can specify an offset from the UTC time by adding a positive or negative time behind the date - like this:
content.html: or you can specify an offset from the UTC time by adding a positive or negative time behind the date - like this:

content.code_html:
<start>2002-09-24-06:00</start>

or

<start>2002-09-24+06:00</start>

content.text: Time Data Type
The time data type is used to specify a time.
content.html: The time data type is used to specify a time.

content.text: The time is specified in the following form "hh:mm:ss" where:
content.html: The time is specified in the following form "hh:mm:ss" where:

content.text: Note: All components are required!
content.html: Note: All components are required!

content.text: The following is an example of a time declaration in a schema:
content.html: The following is an example of a time declaration in a schema:

content.code_html: <xs:element name="start" type="xs:time"/>

content.text: An element in your document might look like this:
content.html: An element in your document might look like this:

content.code_html: <start>09:00:00</start>

content.text: Or it might look like this:
content.html: Or it might look like this:

content.code_html: <start>09:30:10.5</start>

content.text: Time Zones
To specify a time zone, you can either enter a time in UTC time by adding a "Z" behind the time - like this:
content.html: To specify a time zone, you can either enter a time in UTC time by adding a "Z" behind the time - like this:

content.code_html: <start>09:30:10Z</start>

content.text: or you can specify an offset from the UTC time by adding a positive or negative time behind the time - like this:
content.html: or you can specify an offset from the UTC time by adding a positive or negative time behind the time - like this:

content.code_html:
<start>09:30:10-06:00</start>

or

<start>09:30:10+06:00</start>

content.text: DateTime Data Type
The dateTime data type is used to specify a date and a time.
content.html: The dateTime data type is used to specify a date and a time.

content.text: The dateTime is specified in the following form "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss" where:
content.html: The dateTime is specified in the following form "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss" where:

content.text: Note: All components are required!
content.html: Note: All components are required!

content.text: The following is an example of a dateTime declaration in a schema:
content.html: The following is an example of a dateTime declaration in a schema:

content.code_html: <xs:element name="startdate" type="xs:dateTime"/>

content.text: An element in your document might look like this:
content.html: An element in your document might look like this:

content.code_html: <startdate>2002-05-30T09:00:00</startdate>

content.text: Or it might look like this:
content.html: Or it might look like this:

content.code_html: <startdate>2002-05-30T09:30:10.5</startdate>

content.text: Time Zones
To specify a time zone, you can either enter a dateTime in UTC time by adding a "Z" behind the time - like this:
content.html: To specify a time zone, you can either enter a dateTime in UTC time by adding a "Z" behind the time - like this:

content.code_html: <startdate>2002-05-30T09:30:10Z</startdate>

content.text: or you can specify an offset from the UTC time by adding a positive or negative time behind the time - like this:
content.html: or you can specify an offset from the UTC time by adding a positive or negative time behind the time - like this:

content.code_html:
<startdate>2002-05-30T09:30:10-06:00</startdate>

or

<startdate>2002-05-30T09:30:10+06:00</startdate>

content.text: Duration Data Type
The duration data type is used to specify a time interval.
content.html: The duration data type is used to specify a time interval.

content.text: The time interval is specified in the following form "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS" where:
content.html: The time interval is specified in the following form "PnYnMnDTnHnMnS" where:

content.text: The following is an example of a duration declaration in a schema:
content.html: The following is an example of a duration declaration in a schema:

content.code_html: <xs:element name="period" type="xs:duration"/>

content.text: An element in your document might look like this:
content.html: An element in your document might look like this:

content.code_html: <period>P5Y</period>

content.text: The example above indicates a period of five years.
content.html: The example above indicates a period of five years.

content.text: Or it might look like this:
content.html: Or it might look like this:

content.code_html: <period>P5Y2M10D</period>

content.text: The example above indicates a period of five years, two months, and 10 days.
content.html: The example above indicates a period of five years, two months, and 10 days.

content.text: Or it might look like this:
content.html: Or it might look like this:

content.code_html: <period>P5Y2M10DT15H</period>

content.text: The example above indicates a period of five years, two months, 10 days, and 15 hours.
content.html: The example above indicates a period of five years, two months, 10 days, and 15 hours.

content.text: Or it might look like this:
content.html: Or it might look like this:

content.code_html: <period>PT15H</period>

content.text: The example above indicates a period of 15 hours.
content.html: The example above indicates a period of 15 hours.

content.text: Negative Duration
To specify a negative duration, enter a minus sign before the P:
content.html: To specify a negative duration, enter a minus sign before the P:

content.code_html: <period>-P10D</period>

content.text: The example above indicates a period of minus 10 days.
content.html: The example above indicates a period of minus 10 days.

content.text: Date and Time Data Types

content.code_html:
Name Description
date Defines a date value
dateTime Defines a date and time value
duration Defines a time interval
gDay Defines a part of a date - the day (DD)
gMonth Defines a part of a date - the month (MM)
gMonthDay Defines a part of a date - the month and day (MM-DD)
gYear Defines a part of a date - the year (YYYY)
gYearMonth Defines a part of a date - the year and month (YYYY-MM)
time Defines a time value

content.text: Restrictions on Date Data Types
Restrictions that can be used with Date data types:
content.html: Restrictions that can be used with Date data types:
